intro: Hieracium amblygonium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters at the top of the plant, and it produces small, smooth seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium amblygonium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
